Model of VISP1-mediate autophagic degradation of SGS3/RDR6-bodies in Arabidopsis. SGS3/RDR6-bodies mediate dsRNA synthesis for siRNA amplification. Virus infection induce overexpression of VISP1 and selective autophagy. VISP1, a cargo receptor, interacts with SGS3 via the VISP1 Arginine/lysine-rich motif (ARM), and recruits SGS3/RDR6 bodies to ATG8-PE docking site through the VISP1 ubiquitin-interacting motif (UIM). This then promotes selective autophagic degradation of SGS3/RDR6-bodies and negatively regulates amplification of vsiRNAs and tasiRNA.
